# 2. Padding ‚òÅÔ∏è

Padding clears an area around the content (inside the border). It is transparent.

- `padding-top`
- `padding-right`
- `padding-bottom`
- `padding-left`

## Shorthand
`padding: 25px 50px 75px 100px;`
(Top, Right, Bottom, Left - Clockwise üïô)

`padding: 25px;` (All sides)

slides.title: Broaders
slides.content:
# 3. Borders üñºÔ∏è

A border goes around the padding and content.

## Border Style
Required property!
`border-style: solid;` (dotted, dashed, double, groove, ridge, inset, outset, none, hidden)

## Border Width and Color
`border-width: 5px;`
`border-color: red;`

## Shorthand
`border: 5px solid red;`
(width style color)

slides.title: Margins
slides.content:
# 4. Margins ‚ÜîÔ∏è

Margins clear an area outside the border. The margin is transparent.

- `margin-top`
- `margin-right`
- `margin-bottom`
- `margin-left`

## Auto Margin
`margin: auto;` horizontally centers the element within its container.

```css
div {
  width: 300px;
  margin: auto;
}
```

## Margin Collapse
Sometimes top and bottom margins of adjacent elements collapse into a single margin (the largest of the two).

slides.title: Box Sizing
slides.content:
# Box Sizing üìê

By default, `width` + `padding` + `border` = Total Width.
This is annoying!

## border-box
Using `box-sizing: border-box;`, the padding and border are included in the width and height.

```css
* {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}
```

Now, if you set `width: 300px`, the *total* width is 300px, no matter the padding/border. This is best practice!

# Summary üì¶

The Box Model is key to layout.

## Key Takeaways

- ‚úÖ **Content:** The core.
- ‚úÖ **Padding:** Space inside border.
- ‚úÖ **Border:** The line around padding.
- ‚úÖ **Margin:** Space outside border.
- ‚úÖ **box-sizing: border-box** is a lifesaver for layout sanity.
